fgktb.name: Field Guide to the Karrakin Trade Baronies

fgaun.name: Draft Field Guide to the Aun

fgha.name: Draft Field Guide to Harrison Armory

nrfw.name: No Room for a Wallflower Act I

timeline.title: Apollo Departs
timeline.descr: Apollo – the first of the Ten, a series of massive generation ships – departs for an identified Gaia world.

timeline.title: Apollo Lands on Karrakis
timeline.descr: Apollo confirms landfall and establishment of a colony on the planet Karrakis; sequential launches of the next nine ships begin thereafter.

timeline.title: Beginning of The Melee
timeline.descr: 5500-4900bu. After communications with Earth cease due to the Fall, Karrakis planetary admin officials seize control over the colony. The colony devolves into factions and war.

timeline.title: Rihla and Armstrong Depart
timeline.descr: 5000-1000bu. Estimated no-later-than departure date of the generation ships, Rihla and Armstrong, during the Fall

timeline.title: Leading to the Fall
timeline.descr: Catastrophic ecological collapse marks the end of the Anthropocene epoch via irreversible mass extinction and climate change. Historians typically identify this as the point at which the Fall became inevitable for Old Humanity.

timeline.title: Beginning of the Annorum Passacaglia
timeline.descr: 4899bu-1999u. The city-states of Karrakis are forcibly united under Passacaglia, leading to a golden age of sorts on Karrakis.

timeline.title: The Early Passacaglian Period
timeline.descr: 4899bu-3000u. The people of Karrakis rediscover old technology and undergoes a technological renaissance, including exploration beyond their home planet.

timeline.title: The Fall
timeline.descr: 4900-150BU. A dark age. The human population of Cradle (formerly Earth) falls from a peak of around 15 billion to less than 500,000 humans. All contact with the Ten ceases.

timeline.title: The High Passacaglian Period
timeline.descr: 2999bu-1u. A golden age on Karrakis, seeing the people expand their influence to several planets and surrounding systems.

timeline.title: Massif Vault Discovery
timeline.descr: The discovery on Cradle of Massif-A, the first of several pre-Fall vaults, prompts global societal rejuvenation. Additional vaults are identified using data preserved inside , and extant powers race to control them.

timeline.title: Little Wars
timeline.descr: The Little Wars begin – a polarity struggle between Cradle's major powers fueled by the discovery of the Vaults. The accumulation of regional conflicts that followed hurled Cradle into a global war.

timeline.title: Foundation of Union
timeline.descr: The conclusion of the Little Wars leads to the founding of Union and the establishment of the First Committee of Union (FirstComm; retroactively named by the Second Committee).

timeline.title: The Low Passacaglian Period
timeline.descr: 1u-1908u. The slow deterioration of the Passacaglia, seeing corruption on far-removed planets and holdings of Karrakis.

timeline.title: Distress Signals from the Fall
timeline.descr: Long-range communications systems are reactivated, enabling the recovery of countless archived, Fall-age SOS transmissions. The Union Space Program (USP) is announced shortly thereafter.

timeline.title: Seeking Gaia Worlds
timeline.descr: The first Nearlight-class interstellar ships – based on plans preserved in the Massif vaults and built using Theseus – are launched, seeking Gaia worlds identified in legacy star charts.

timeline.title: First Expansion / Exodus
timeline.descr: 1700-1999U. Expansion within Cradle takes place. Union mounts expeditions across the worlds and moons of the Cradle system, repopulating old stations, installations, and colonies.

timeline.title: Yggdrasil lands on Sparr
timeline.descr: One of the Ten, a generation ship named Yggdrasil, lands on Sparr

timeline.title: The Antiannorum
timeline.descr: 1908u-1999u. Corruption across the Concern reaches a breaking point. Planets revolt against Karrakis rule and war breaks out.

timeline.title: Boundary Garden Distress Signals
timeline.descr: The USP Anthem, a Nearlight C.8 vessel associated with the Boundary Garden mission, reports first contact with distress beacons from two of the Ten – the Rihla and the Armstrong – and those descended from their original crews: the Aunic peoples, organized under the Aun Ecumene on a nearby habitable world.

timeline.title: Aun First Contact with Union
timeline.descr: First Contact with Union. Cornucopia settled as part of contact contingency, Boundary Garden named.

timeline.title: Aunic Planetary Control and First Enumenical Mandate
timeline.descr: 1998-2100u. Integration of early Union colony, Anthem, under the Aun. The Aunic peoples establish control over Aun’Ist. The Ecumenical Mandate formally established.

timeline.title: Discovery of the Oracle Chorus
timeline.descr: The Oracle Chorus installation is discovered under the Vastitas Borealis of Mars. The installation is reactivated, and the Five Voices – advanced machine minds capable of predicting the future with nearperfect precision – are identified. This creates the foundations for what would later become Forecast/ Galactic Simulation.

timeline.title: The Annorum Tyrannus
timeline.descr: 2000-2089u. Tyrannus suppresses the revolts on another planetary and returns to take over Karrakis, ending the bloody war there, as well as the Annorum Passacaglia.

timeline.title: Discovery of Old Human Colonies
timeline.descr: Several Old Human colonies are discovered beyond Cradle – some derelict, others inhabited. The Union Administrative Department (UAD) is created to oversee interstellar expansion efforts and the reintegration of all rediscovered exclaves.

timeline.title: The Succession War
timeline.descr: 2003-2017u. Tyrannus' son, Tagetes, reconquers the revolting planets of the Concern. Tyrannus, Tagetes, and his daughter work to resolve any potential succession disputes.

timeline.title: The Dynasticlade
timeline.descr: Message broadcast on behalf of Tyrannus' and his children stating that the Annorum is ending and power will be transferred to a New Federation.

timeline.title: The New Federation
timeline.descr: 2089-3150u. The New Federation serves as the ruling body of the Karrakin peoples after the Dynasticlade.

timeline.title: First Dawn Period
timeline.descr: 2100-2869u. First Dawn period ushered in by the manifestation of Metat Aun above Aun’Ist. Dramatic expansion of the Ecumenical Mandate catalyzed by Metat Aun.

timeline.title: Boundary Garden Settlements
timeline.descr: 2100-2869u. Cornucopia system (incl. Borea, Dodona, and Calvary) and Golgotha system (incl. Olduvai) settled by Union nearlighters during this time.

timeline.title: Union Contacts New Federation (KTB)
timeline.descr: Union's first contact with the New Federation, which later became the Karrakin Trade Baronies.

timeline.title: First Corncucopian Civil War
timeline.descr: Ecumenical Mandate mounts an exploratory campaign into the Cornucopia system, peacefully annexing the Union worlds of Borea, Dodona, and Calvary.

timeline.title: Second Contact Between Union and Aun
timeline.descr: Diplomatic friction between the Aunic peoples and Union colonies in Boundary Garden leads to the First Distal War.

timeline.title: First Committee Dissolved, Second Committee Takes Over Union
timeline.descr: In furious rejection of the First Committee’s perceived capitulation in the Cornucopia system, a military coup deposes the First Committee and launches a retaliatory attack aimed towards the Aunic homeworld: TBK PISTON-1, a spread of silent-flying, guided planet-killing weapon systems. The Second Committee is formally established.

timeline.title: The First Union-Karrakin War
timeline.descr: 2885-2998u. A militant group of Karrakins bombed a Union diplomatic yacht. Union annhialated Karrakin defenses, but just before they reached Karrakis, Union turned around and left.

timeline.title: Aunic Civil War
timeline.descr: 2890-????u. Ecumenical Mandate’s response triggers a Mandate-wide schism, prompting the Aunic Civil War; concludes with the dissolution of the Ecumenical Mandate and formalization of the Ecclesiastic Ascendancy, or, Aunic Ascendancy as the ruling body of the Aunic peoples.

timeline.title: Second Dawn Period Begins
timeline.descr: 2890-4800u. Second Dawn Period begins with return of Metat Aun. Aunic re-contact with Apollonians. Also, Aun introduced to Firmament, Minds.

timeline.title: Cornucopian Royal Family Flees to Golgotha
timeline.descr: ~2890u. The newly constituted Second Committee intervenes on behalf of the Cornucopian royal family, preventing Aunic forces from establishing a foothold on Golgotha; Golgotha is renamed “Dawn Throne” by the royal family, and announced as the new legitimate seat of theCornucopia-Golgotha system.

timeline.title: Manifestation of MONIST-1
timeline.descr: During the course of a forecast iteration, the Five Voices manifest MONIST-1 (also known as “RA”). MONIST-1 is retroactively classified as the first NHP.

timeline.title: MONIST-1 Ascends
timeline.descr: MONIST-1 ascends, bringing about the Deimos Event – the complete disappearance of Deimos from known space. The study of paracausal science becomes possible. The disparate ships, shuttles, and force organizations of the USP are reorganized into the Union Navy.

timeline.title: First Contact Accords Signed
timeline.descr: The First Contact Accords are signed in negotiations with MONIST-1 following the Siege of Mars. The concept of “non-human persons” is defined and applied to the anomalous machine minds left behind. The shackling process is developed to constrain NHPs.

timeline.title: Smith-Shimano Shifts Focus to Bio-Enhancements
timeline.descr: The FCA signing causes SSC to switch from focusing on transhumanism and AI to enhancing the human body to its limits.

timeline.title: The New Prosperity Agreement
timeline.descr: A second Union-Karrakin is averted due to Union technological supremacy. The New Prosperity Agreement sees the Federal Karrakin Monarchy formally become part of Union.

timeline.title: Blinkspace Access
timeline.descr: 3130-3200u. Blinkspace is identified and pierced. The technology to create blink fields is developed, and the first blink station is built. The UAD is dissolved and replaced with the Union Colonial Mission (UCM).

timeline.title: Ras Shamra Colony Approved
timeline.descr: Rights given to mining families to colonize Ras Shamra.

timeline.title: Evolution of Karrakin Trade Baronies
timeline.descr: 3150-5016u. 1400 years of rebuilding, expansion, and investment to modernize everything in the Federal Karrakin Monarchy. Over time, the Federal Karrakin Monarchy becomes known at the Karrakin Trade Baronies.

timeline.title: Ras Shamra Settled
timeline.descr: Cosmopolitan families and partners, totaling around five thousand, arrive and settle Ras Shamra.

timeline.title: Second Expansion Period Begins
timeline.descr: 3200-4599u. The Second Expansion Period begins, as the Second Committee begins a massive, Unionwide colonization and expansion effort throughout the Orion Arm of the galaxy. The blink network is grown through rapid construction of gates, and billions of colonists are sent out to tens of thousands of worlds over this time. This period represents the single largest movement of human life in recorded history.

timeline.title: Union Colonial Mission Crashes on Sparr
timeline.descr: UCM team focused on recontacting lost colonies crash lands on Sparr.

timeline.title: Ras Shamra Pandemic
timeline.descr: 3350-3360. Pandemic sweeps over Ras Shamra, wrecking both massive parts of the population and forcing people to live in specific quarantined areas.

timeline.title: Beginning of First Temperate Period
timeline.descr: 3360-3500. This period is focused on rebuilding and slowly expanding habitats after the Plague.

timeline.title: Ras Shamra Cedes Control to Union
timeline.descr: 3500-3600u. The Second Committee arrives with a full colonial mission, outnumbering the current population. The Ras Shamran Trium gives control to Union's Second Committee and work on the equatorial arcology band begins.

timeline.title: GMS Site Built on Ras Shamra
timeline.descr: GMS surveys and builds a Special Project site on Ras Shamra.

timeline.title: Second Temperate Period on Ras Shamra
timeline.descr: 3600-4500u. This period sees Ras Shamra turn into a global GMS powerhouse and supply 30% of all infantry, terrestrial armored vehicle, aerial, and orbital weaponry for the Second Committee.

timeline.title: Union returns to Sparr
timeline.descr: Union returns to contact Sparr. Fighting breaks out between Union forces and the Sparri forces serving the cascading NHP, Ynneval.

timeline.title: Hercynian Crisis
timeline.descr: 4500-4560u. The Hercynian Crisis. During the course of the conflict, the efficacy of hardsuits and mechanized chassis (“mechs”) is demonstrated. Union’s state manufacturer, General Massive Systems, begins galaxy-wide production of mechanized chassis.

timeline.title: Second Committee Launches TBK on Hercynia
timeline.descr: A protracted war, lasting for sixty years, on Hercynia culminates in the Second Committee's use of a Total Biome Killer, TBK for short, that devestates the surface and environments of the planet.

timeline.title: Union Civil War
timeline.descr: 4560-4591u. Mounting discontent with the great expansion, the growing need to address PISTON-1, and the acute criminality of the Hercynian Crisis boil over into widespread popular revolution across Cradle and some Galactic Core worlds. Union is gripped by civil war.

timeline.title: Second Committee Surrenders
timeline.descr: The remaining Central Committee members of the Second Committee agree to terms of surrender in 4591u. Some portions of Second Committee flee to Diasporan planets or to places such at Harrison Armory.

timeline.title: Second Committee Surrenders, Founding of Third Committee
timeline.descr: New stable government in Union is formed, the Third Committee (ThirdComm). The Union Colonial Mission is immediately dissolved and the Union Administrative Department is reconstituted. Expansion is halted.

timeline.title: Harrison Armory Established
timeline.descr: John Creighton Harrison I and a number of loyalists flee to Ras Shamra and establish Harrison Armory.

timeline.title: Third Temperate Period
timeline.descr: 4600-4815u. Harrison Armory focuses on developing the Purview and the Armory's three Special Project Arcologies. The latter begins churning out new mech chassis designs.

timeline.title: The First Interest War
timeline.descr: Harrison Armory and the Karrakin Trade Baronies engage in the First Interest War; Union acts as a neutral party, ultimately securing peace. Harrison I returns to Cradle and faces justice in exchange for the Armory’s continued sovereignty; the Baronies agree to become a member state of Union.

timeline.title: John Harrison I's Execution
timeline.descr: John Harrison I turns himself in to ThirdComm authorities and is executed by hanging.

timeline.title: John Harrison II Takes the Harrison Armory Throne
timeline.descr: After the execution of John Harrison I, JH I's clone son, JH II, takes his seat on the Temperate Throne.

timeline.title: Sparri Diaspora Population Surpasses Population on Sparr
timeline.descr: The veneration of wanderlust by the Sparri and their affiliation with the Voladores sees them spread throughout Union space, to the point that the diaspora of Sparri outnumber those on their homeworld.

timeline.title: Second Cornucopian Civil War
timeline.descr: Seeded Ascendancy agents capture hundreds of GMS chassis following Ascendancy backed troops securing Dawn Throne. Development of Ofanim begins.

timeline.title: Birth of the Egregorian Overmind Endeavor
timeline.descr: Approximate year Endeavor, a name later given by the Hercynians who found them, is born.

timeline.title: Aboveground Farming on Hercynia Becomes Possible
timeline.descr: The effects of Second Committee's TBK, and other relevant events, devestated Hercynia's above ground landscape for hundreds of years.

timeline.title: John Harrison II Dies
timeline.descr: John Harrison II, and many others, die at RA's hand during the Black Throne Incident.

timeline.title: John Harrison III Takes the Temperate Throne
timeline.descr: John Creighton-Cruz Harrison III, the facsimile son of John Creighton Harrison I and the noble line of Miramar de la Cruz, a ranked noble whose family was granted Decimal Honors 3 to the throne.

timeline.title: John Harrison III Begins the Ageless Survey of the Purview
timeline.descr: 4828-5017u. John Harrison III is sent on a survey of all planets on HA's Purview while the Stewards run the Armory.

timeline.title: Fourth Temperate Period
timeline.descr: 4828-5016u. Fourth Temperate Period, wherein the Stewards rule while JCH III tours the Purview, continues to present (5016u) time.

timeline.title: GOBLIN Leaked
timeline.descr: GOBLIN mech chassis is leaked onto the omninet.

timeline.title: Union Survey Drones Rediscover Hercynia
timeline.descr: Union survey drones on a routine contraction-zone survey discover radio emissions and more coming from Hercynia.

timeline.title: The Hercynian United Cities is Founded
timeline.descr: The Machine's attacks on Solo Terra lead to surrounding city-states forming a confederacy - the Hercynian United Cities.

timeline.title: Landmark Colonial Makes Landfall on Hercynia
timeline.descr: Landmark Colonial, one of SSC's autonomous subsidiaries, makes landfall on the planet Hercynia and establishes the Evergreen colony.

timeline.title: Founding of Merricktown on Hercynia
timeline.descr: Jacob Merrick's grandfather creates a sublease town outside Evergreen - Merricktown.

timeline.title: War Breaks Out Between the HUC and the Machine
timeline.descr: The Machine begins advancing on the Hercynian United Cities.

timeline.title: The Chaus Family Arrives at Evergreen
timeline.descr: Matriarchs Maggie and Weiyi Chau arrive in Evergreen, a colony on Hercynia, aboard a hauling skiff with little fuel.

timeline.title: Third Dawn Period
timeline.descr: Estimated beginning of Third Dawn Period. First contact of Crusade forces reported at Borea, Dodona, and Calvary -- all minor colony worlds in the Boundary Garden sector of Union space.

timeline.title: Second Distal War Begins
timeline.descr: The presence of an Aunic crusade fleet in Boundary Garden is confirmed. For the first time, a blink gate is lost to hostile state actions. The Second Distal War begins.

timeline.title: Fansipan Blink Gate Activated in Boundary Garden
timeline.descr: Union's Fansipan blink gate is completed and activated.

timeline.title: Fansipan Blink Gate Destroyed by Aunic Forces
timeline.descr: Perceiving the Fansipan blink gate as a threat to their borders, the Aun launch a suicide attack and destroy the blink gate.

timeline.title: Unknown Assailants Attack Evergreen
timeline.descr: Unknown assailants begin a series of attacks against Evergreen, a colony on the planet Hercynia.

timeline.title: Narrative Present for No Room for a Wallflower Act I
Narrative Present for Lancer Core Rulebook
Formation of the Concordant Administration
timeline.descr: A group of Baronies-aligned states on New Creighton ally together to create a power-sharing bloc called the Concordant Administration.

timeline.title: The Dawnline Incident
timeline.descr: 5019-5021u. Hostilities break out between Harrison Armory and the Baronies in the Dawnline Shore. Union Navy attempts to intervene with military force before full-scale war breaks out.

timeline.title: Concordant Administration Attacks the Perfect Ministeriat
timeline.descr: Vanguard forces of the Concordant Administration mount a surprise attack on key installations belonging to the Perfect Ministeriat and its satellite nations.

timeline.title: The Battle for New Creighton
timeline.descr: Late 5019u. Harrison Armory and the Perfect Ministeriat launch a campaign against the Concordant Administration and Baronic forces both on and above New Creighton. Union creates a battlegroup enforced corridor to support evacuation, leading to the Armory firing on Union forces.

timeline.title: Union Disables Dawnline Shore Blink Gate
timeline.descr: Late 5019u. Rapidly escalating tensions and violence between the Baronies and Harrison Armory in the Dawnline Shore causes Union to shutdown the as yet unnamed Dawnline Shore blink gate.

timeline.title: The Armory's Defense of Harrison's World
timeline.descr: Early 5020u. Union launches a surgical strike against a major fabrication facility on Harrison's World. The Armory defends orbital shipyards from incoming Baronic forces.

timeline.title: The Baronic Defense of Upper Laurent
timeline.descr: Early 5020u. Baronic forces gather reinforcements from the Upper Laurent while also defending the planet against the Armory's incoming interplanetary missiles.

timeline.title: The Battle of Terminal Ring Station
timeline.descr: Late 5020u. Harrison Armory forces land on Terminal, a ring habitat station near New Madrassa, to try and capture a Baronic VIP. Union and Baronic forces race against the Armory, and one another, to extract the VIP first.

timeline.title: Armory Forces Engage Union Near Arkady II
timeline.descr: Early 5021u. Armory forces arrive from the Long Rim nadir beachhead and engage the Union blockade at the termination shockline near Arkady II.

timeline.title: Baronic Forces Attack the Armory at Gloria
timeline.descr: Early 5021u. Baronic forces arrive from the Concern and attack Armory defenses at the planet Gloria.

timeline.title: Three Way Battle at the Long Rim Apex Beachhead
timeline.descr: Early 5021u. Baronic reinforcements arrive from the heavily trafficked Long Rim apex beachhead and are immediately engaged by Armory forces. Union attempts to stand them both down, resulting in the first 3-way fight of the Dawnline Incident.

timeline.title: Final Engagement of the Dawnline Incident
timeline.descr: Late 5021u. Harrison Armory launches a "liberation" attack on New Madrassa. Baronic forces counterattack. Union joins with the Baronic forces to keep the Armory at bay.

timeline.title: Hypothesized Creation of Lich chassis
timeline.descr: Only known date for Lich creation, though could have been faked by HORUS hackers.

timeline.title: Civil war on Opal
timeline.descr: Opal, SSC's primary colony world devolves into civil war, leading to the destruction of the corpro-state's R&D campus and major manufactories.

timeline.title: First Wave of NHPs
timeline.descr: Following the manifestation of MONIST-1 into realspace, the first wave of NHPs emerges.

timeline.title: Inter-Deimos Period
timeline.descr: 3000-3002u. Deimos is missing. The Second Committee covers up its absence by suppressing information and falsifying USB reports, while also beginning a program of heightened military production and mobilization.

timeline.title: Second Wave of NHPs
timeline.descr: Following the reappearance of MONIST-1, the second wave of NHPs emerges.

timeline.title: Third Wave of NHPs
timeline.descr: 3002u-present. New NHPs periodically emerge, classified as a third wave. These emergences are infrequent but intensify after 4900u, when analysis of H0r_OS INSTINCT paracode spurs breakthroughs in protomind development.

timeline.title: Constellar Congress Construction
timeline.descr: Second Expansion Period. SSC begins construction on the Constellar Congress, an ambitious physical and digital infrastructure project designed to support a shared virtual omninet campus.

timeline.title: The Ganiki Incident
timeline.descr: Research campuses under Venus's Ganiki Planitia go dark and the archives are sealed. When they are reopened, many NHPs were missing or altered, displaced by unknown paracausal activity.

timeline.title: Fiaraidh Dyson Swarm Project
timeline.descr: Facing challenges building and powering blink gates, the UCM establishes a research base in the Sierra Madre line for the development of Dyson swarm technology.

timeline.title: Rise of HORUS
timeline.descr: 4900u onwards. Influenced by unknown parties, HORUS begins to develop from a series of disconnected cells and collectives into one of the "big four" galactic suppliers of mech licenses.

timeline.title: Project XENIA
timeline.descr: UIB Project XENIA is established to monitor systems incursions and data manifestation events associated with HORUS and metavault paracode.

timeline.title: The ASURA Breach
timeline.descr: Unknown parties acquire and release proprietary data from secure Harrison Armory servers, bringing to light questionable practices during the development of the ASURA-class NHP. A CentComm investigation is commissioned and Horizon Collective membership swells.
